1.comment: Donnie Avery had 4 catches and 73 yards, including a great, 1.handed, 43-yard grab that set the Rams up for their winning field goal.

3.comment: Donnie Avery, who caught 6 passes for 163 yards. The 69-yard Bulger-to-Avery touchdown was Bulger's longest score of his career.    Oh, but the Patriots can't stop the run either. No Steven Jackson? Still a huge problem.

4.comment: Donnie Avery didn't do much, registering 3 catches for 26 yards.

5.comment: Donnie Avery and Torry Holt consequently caught 2 and 1 passes, respectively.

6.comment: Donnie Avery caught more passes (9) than Darby. He also paced the team with 93 yards.

7.comment: Donnie Avery didn't catch a pass.    It amazes me that Miami wasn't able to run the ball in this contest.

8.comment: Donnie Avery, had more than 2 grabs.

11.comment: Donnie Avery disappointed with 1 catch for 4 yards. It might be time to consider Robinson as the better fantasy option.

12.comment: Donnie Avery, who caught just 3 balls for 12 yards. Consider dropping him if he's on your fantasy roster.

13.comment: Donnie Avery showed some signs of life for the first time all year, catching 5 passes for 87 yards and a late touchdown from Bulger.    Moving on to a real NFL team,

14.comment: Donnie Avery, who caught that 1 pass for 17 yards. Unfortunately, Avery left the game in the second quarter because of a bruised hip.    The Rams have now dropped 16 games in a row. At least they weren't all in the same season.

15.comment: Donnie Avery (2 catches, 58 yards) snagged a beautiful 50-yard reception off a flea flicker. However, St. Louis' wideouts were guilty of 3 drops in the first quarter alone. And aside from that catch, the Rams had just 76 yards in the first half.

16.comment: Donnie Avery had just 1 catch for 15 yards.

17.comment: Donnie Avery grabbed both of Bulger's scores, finishing with 4 receptions for 67 yards.

18.comment: Donnie Avery caught 4 passes for 65 yards, while Brandon Gibson finished with 5 grabs for 61 yards.

19.comment: Donnie Avery (4 catches, 48 yards) nor Brandon Gibson (3-18) did much, though Avery caught a touchdown.

20.comment: Donnie Avery and Brandon Gibson each caught 3 balls for 30 and 38 yards, respectively. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

21.comment: Donnie Avery was targeted a whopping 13 times, as he came up with 9 catches for 111 yards. Luck loves throwing to him, so he must be picked up in all fantasy formats.    The Colts struggled to run the ball, which is why they couldn't put the Vikings away.

22.comment: Donnie Avery was also thrown to frequently, but managed to haul in only 2 of his 9 targets for 28 yards.

23.comment: Donnie Avery (3-22) but just missed him.    The Colts ran the ball well because Raji was out for half the game.

24.comment: Donnie Avery dropped ball at the 2-yard line and a potential fumble that had to be reviewed. The Colts received possession first in overtime and aimed to score a touchdown right away to avoid giving the Titans a chance.

25.comment: Donnie Avery (5-108) late in the second quarter. It was a great throw that beat the double coverage. Luck then launched a great deep ball to

27.comment: Donnie Avery, who actually hauled in 2 touchdowns to go along with his 5 catches for 91 yards. TY Hilton paced the team with 6 grabs for 100 yards, while

28.comment: Donnie Avery caught a long touchdown in the 4.h quarter; the ball bounced off his helmet. Luck had issues with pressure the entire afternoon, however. He was sacked 4 times, twice by

29.comment: Donnie Avery (5-38), catching 5 balls for 81 yards and the score. TY Hilton (2-34) disappointed.    Indianapolis' rush defense is a major concern. Kansas City racked up a whopping 352 net rushing yards.

30.comment: Donnie Avery dropped a catchable ball, and then Adam Vinatieri followed that up with a missed kick from 40 yards.

31.comment: Donnie Avery. In fact, Kansas City ran the same place twice, yet Billy Davis' unit wasn't prepared for it. That's inexcusable. The Chiefs would've scored way more than 26 points had they not made errors themselves. They bogged down in the red zone and dropped 4 passes in the first quarter alone. The offensive line was also guilty of several illegal formations. I'm not sure why the Chiefs continuously had issues lining up, but their inability to do so disrupted some of their drives. I don't want to take anything away from

32.comment: Donnie Avery, meanwhile, led the team with 91 receiving yards off 3 catches.    Charles once again had a huge performance. He rushed for 108 yards and a touchdown to go along with 5 catches for 37 receiving yards. His only mistake was a lost fumble after a fierce hit, but the Titans couldn't take advantage of that turnover. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

33.comment: Donnie Avery (2-6), who lost a fumble in the red zone during the second half.

34.comment: Donnie Avery, but once he fell way behind, he just couldn't do anything because he can't get the ball downfield. Smith, who is a sub-par quarterback being coached up to playing above-average football, is the primary reason I never slotted Kansas City above No. 8 in my .    I mentioned that Bowe had a deep drop, but he played well otherwise despite his arrest during the week, as he led the team in receiving with 4 catches for 57 yards and a legitimate touchdown in the second quarter. Charles, however, wasn't a big factor in the passing game, hauling in just 2 balls for a loss of 6 receiving yards. He also notched 78 rushing yards on 16 carries.    Two other notable Chiefs:

35.comment: Donnie Avery (4-91), Dwayne Bowe (5-51) and Anthony Fasano (4-21).

36.comment: Donnie Avery having 2 bad drops on passes downfield, Smith methodically moved the ball. At the goal line,

39.comment: Donnie Avery to intercept the pass in Chiefs territory. That led to a Tennessee field goal before the half.    To open the third quarter, Locker drooped in a perfect pass to Justin Hunter (3-63) for 39 yards. Locker kept moving the ball down the field before a 6-yard touchdown pass to Kendall Wright (6-46) on third-and-goal. Midway through the same quarter, Smith threw a mirror image of his first interception that was picked off by McCourty again. Locker then moved the ball for a field goal. The Chiefs had 1 drive that ended with Anthony Fasano catching a 5.yard touchdown, but that was all the Kansas City offense could muster. Locker led another field goal drive to ice the win.    Locker completed 22-of-33 passes for 266 yards with 2 touchdowns. Fantasy owners of Bishop Sankey (6-25) have to be worried as the Titans favored Shonn Greene (15-71) and Dexter McCluster (9-29). Perhaps Sankey will get a bigger role as the year wears on, and he flashed in the second half with a 12-yard run. Greene is clearly a limited player.    Smith completed 19-of-35 passes for 202 yards with a touchdown and 3 interceptions. He ran for 36 yards on 6 carries, too. The Chiefs' wide receivers predictably struggled, as Donnie Avery (7-84) and tight end Travis Kelce (3-49) led the team.

40.comment: Donnie Avery (3-14) and Dwayne Bowe (3-40), who didn't do much in his 2014 debut.
